DOC.brief_summary: The study was primarily designed to assess the role of acupuncture in reducing the need for epidural analgesia for pain relief during induced labour. The other outcomes of labour were to be observed in addition.
DOC.brief_title: Acupuncture for Pain Relief During Induced Labour in Nulliparae
DOC.detailed_description: The study was limited to women in their first pregnancy having labour induced for prolonged pregnancy or mild hypertension. The study involved randomised groups managed with manual acupuncture, electro acupuncture, sham acupuncture and a no-treatment control group.
DOC.criteria: nulliparae having labour induced for prolonged pregnancy or mild hypertension no previous experience of acupuncture give written informed consent all who do not meet the inclusion criteria
